env.jme

Class Environment

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jme3.app.LegacyApplication
      • com.jme3.app.SimpleApplication
        • env.jme.Environment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.jme3.app.Application, com.jme3.system.SystemListener

    public class Environment
extends com.jme3.app.SimpleApplication
    Class assembling all the environment with every objects composing the world (terrain, players,..).
    Author:
    WonbinLIM

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • launch

        public static void launch(java.lang.String filename)
        Launches the given file's heightmap. -warning- the heightmap file must be a txt file, using the following syntaxe : sizeoftheheightmap int:int:int:.....:int int:int:int:.....:int ... int:int:int:.....:int - each int is a integer representing the height of one position of the map. - the size of the heightmap must be a power of two (ex: 64,128,..).
        Parameters:
        filename - name of the file containing the heightmap

      • launchRandom

        public static void launchRandom(int size)
        Generates and launches a random heightmap of the given size. - the size of the heightmap must be a power of two (ex: 64,128,..).
        Parameters:
        size - size of the heightmap

      • deployAgent

        public boolean deployAgent(java.lang.String agentName,
                           java.lang.String playertype)
        Creates a new playeragent or enemyagent in the environment.
        Parameters:
        agentName - name of the agent we want to deploy.
        playertype - type of the agent : player or enemy.
        Returns:
        true if the agent is deployed, false if an agent with this name already exists.

      • moveTo

        public boolean moveTo(java.lang.String agent,
                      com.jme3.math.Vector3f dest)
        Makes an agent go to the specific coordinates of the world.
        Parameters:
        agent - name of the agent we want to move.
        dest - coordinates of the destination.
        Returns:
        true if we can move the agent, false if the agent's already there.

      • randomMove

        public boolean randomMove(java.lang.String agent)
        Makes an agent go to random coordinates of the world.
        Parameters:
        agent -
        Returns:
        true if we can move the agent, false if the agent's already there.

      • shoot

        public boolean shoot(java.lang.String agent,
                     java.lang.String enemy)
        Shooting process : an agent shoot at another agent.
        Parameters:
        agent - the name of the agent who wants to shoot.
        enemy - the name of the target agent.
        Returns:
        true if the shooting has succeeded, false if the enemy doesn't exist or if the shooting has failed.

      • observe

        public java.util.List<dataStructures.tuple.Tuple2<com.jme3.math.Vector3f,java.lang.String>> observe(java.lang.String agentName)
        observes around the agent, according to its field of view, and returns all the agents detected.
        Parameters:
        agentName - name of the agent who observes.
        Returns:
        a list of all the agents around the observer.

        public com.jme3.math.Vector3f getCurrentPosition(java.lang.String agent)
        returns the agent's current position
        Parameters:

        Returns:
